technical_analysis.Introduction: The draft-07-schema vulnerability is a schema validation issue that could allow an attacker to manipulate data and allow for remote code execution and data exfiltration.
technical_analysis.Impact and Scope: The potential impact of this vulnerability is high, as it could allow an attacker to gain unauthorized access to the system and execute malicious code. The scope of the vulnerability is limited to systems that use the vulnerable schema.
technical_analysis.Related MITRE ATT&CK Techniques: The related MITRE ATT&CK techniques are T1059.001 - Command and Control, T1534 - Service Execution, T1139 - External Remote Services, T1047 - Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI), T1210 - Exploitation of Remote Services, T1190 - Exploitation of Trust Relationships, T1567 - Actions on Objects in Memory, and T1211 - Exploitation of Public-Facing Application.
technical_analysis.Technical Details: The vulnerability is located in the $schema property of the JSON schema, which allows an attacker to manipulate the schema and inject malicious code.
technical_analysis.detection: Detection for this vulnerability could be performed by monitoring for unusual network traffic and system activity.
technical_analysis.Mitigation: To mitigate this vulnerability, it is recommended to validate the $schema property of the JSON schema and implement strict input validation and sanitization.
technical_analysis.Conclusion: The draft-07-schema vulnerability is a potentially serious vulnerability that could allow an attacker to gain unauthorized access to the system and execute malicious code. It is recommended to implement strict input validation and sanitization and monitor for unusual network traffic and system activity to detect and mitigate this vulnerability.
